intro: Tragia tristis f. volubilis, commonly known as the weeping tragia, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. It is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain regions.
